content: today I'm gonna be trying out the roll maker from green stuff WorldCom hey guys
welcome back to another episode of black magic crafts it is reviews day Tuesday
and that means I'm gonna share with you a product that I may or may not think is
cool today it is the roll maker from green stuff WorldCom these are little
plastic plates with a pattern on them that you can roll out green stuff or
polymer clay to create tentacles and wires and different types of cool
sculptural elements this isn't exactly a review because I have yet to use this
product they had sent it to me quite a while ago and it's been on the back
burner I haven't got around to trying it out yet so today I'm going to test it
out for the first time and share my experience with you guys so it's less of
a review based on long-term use and more of a first impression and a live first
time demonstration so it's either gonna be really easy and work really well and
give you an idea of what to expect if you get it and open it up or it's not
gonna work very well and it's gonna be complicated I don't know I haven't used
it yet so let's try it out full disclosure and this is not a sponsored
video by green stuff world they did not pay for this video however they did send
me the product for free and they have set up a promo code for my viewers that
I will put in the video description below that they give me for whenever I
share their products with you guys and using that code triggers a referral
program for me and they do give me a small finder's fee for all those orders
but my impressions of these are gonna be my own and honestly I don't know what to
expect the stuff on the package looks pretty cool so hope it works really well
let's try it out inside there are six plastic plates with segmented lines
printed on them so if you take a look here they just have a bunch of ridges
and you'll see this one is marked medium there are three sizes small
medium and large and there are two of each and then there are these little
plastic clips that connect these together to make the rolls so I did a
little bit of research just to see how to actually use this because there
aren't really clear instructions on the package and what you want to use is some
sort of clay like either green stuff or you can also use something like fimo or
sculpey the reason I'm not going to test it with fimo we're sculpey is because as
some of you know I'm renovating my kitchen and I don't have a working oven
right now to bake it so I'm going to use green stuff just gonna cut some of this
up and mix it together and we'll be good to go okay so I have some green stuff
mixed up and I'm gonna break it into a few small segments so I can test out
different combinations of these plates because that is how they work different
combinations and orientations will actually create different textures
according to the packaging there are a bunch of cool different designs that you
can make so it's gonna roll out a little bit of green stuff so you want to make a
roll at whatever thickness you want your tentacle to be we will try with the
large first because I have a feeling it will work the easiest so there's these
little guide pieces that have almost like little Lego interlocking things
that click in to the plates and to start off we are gonna do this my
understanding is that you get different patterns depending on the orientation
the basic way is just to run them the same direction so I have a large one and
a large one and I'm gonna put my bit of green stuff in the middle I'm going to
take my corresponding large plate put it the same direction as the lower one
squish it down a little bit and just roll it back and forth and it's a little
bit bumpy at first as it evens out and then it gets smooth and we are left with
tentacle pretty cool pattern on it so this one
creates kind of like almost looks like a screw so that's using the large ones
both in the same direction now one thing I saw when I was researching that you
can do is you can take the flat side of one of these and rectify the the ridges
to make them a little bit flatter and wider so now it has a slightly different
kind of look to it and this looks like an industrial cable let's do another one
using the large again but we'll run it with opposite plate directions place it
in the middle so the bottom plate lines are going vertically I'm going to turn
these run them horizontally and see what happens so this creates slightly
different pattern I'm not quite sure how best to describe but it almost creates
these little square bumps which looks really really interesting then of course
you know once you have your texture you can position these and let them cure
okay so that is the large one let's try the small one just to see how different
it really is okay small and small running the same direction this little
should make another screw like texture but smaller and yeah this looks really
good excellent for industrial cabling one thing I did not try apparently you
can run these you have 45 degrees so I'm gonna try with I'm gonna keep with
trying the big one just because I think it shows up on camera the best and it
was a little bit easier to demonstrate so if we take this it's at 45 degrees
and I'm gonna take this one I think also put it
at 45 degrees you can't put the clip on both sides when you do this you have to
just put it on one but I'm not sure if I'm going to do this right here on the
tray although I don't know if there's a wrong way to do this I think any
combination creates interesting textures so this made more of a twisted kind of
corkscrew shape it didn't turn out to all I don't think I got the technique
quite right I'm gonna try it again this time I'm gonna press a little bit harder
and see if I can get a more defined texture from it oops mmm
my green stuffs getting pretty sticky that didn't really work and put some
water about watering spit see if it stops it from sticking a little bit yeah
moves a little bit freer with some spit on there and I think that one worked out
quite a bit better that orientation is a little bit more difficult to do and I
think requires a little bit more practice than some of the other ones so
now what I'd like to try is using two different sizes so I'm gonna use the
large one on the bottom let's say medium one on top running the same direction oh
that's really interesting this makes much more organic shape this is so far
the one that I think would work best for worms or guts or entrails I really like
that twist that up a bit so it cures in a cool shape the two different sizes but
at opposite orientations so large size going vertically medium one going
horizontally and I'm gonna put this other guide back on because I found it
actually harder to do it without it because I'm not used to these yet so
again makes this kind of interesting texture with these little square sort of
spikes this would be really good for alien
vegetation and bizarre vines what I haven't tried doing yet is running them
both horizontally and again I'm going to do large and large together because it
kind of shows up the best both horizontally what does this do that
didn't work too well let's try it again not very even because I think this one
requires a little bit more technique to do properly but it gives it this almost
kind of looks like a like a pumpkin stem sort of look to it again probably good
for vegetation so that's just a handful of combinations I mean you could do so
many different combinations of these with the different orientations and
combinations of sizes and I probably only briefly touched on the main ones
this is my first time using the product I think it's really easy to use a couple
of the orientations are a little bit more difficult and would you know
require some practice but some of them worked really easy right out of the
package I'm a fan I like it I'm gonna use these again I'm gonna play with them
a bit more and then I'm gonna start making some weird stuff out of them like
you know weird vines tentacles good for spell markers for some dandy spells use
tentacles gonna be great for doing custom minis and what I would like to
use these fours entrails coming out of a weird bizarre monster all sorts of cool
stuff also what's cool is that they have an extra-large version that I didn't
even try out yet because I wanted to try the basic one it's the same thing just
bigger so you could make much larger tentacles I don't really want to try
that with green stuff I don't want to waste that much green stuff when I have
in the back working again try with some polymer clay or some oven-baked clay I
guess and I think it would be really awesome if you like these you think they
would be handy if you do mini sculpting these are pretty phenomenal actually I
mean they're kind of a one-trick pony they make tentacles out of clay not
everyone has a need for those but it sure is nifty and it does something that
you cannot do by hand like other ways there's no way I don't think that you
could sculpt these easily without this sort of tool again there will be a link
in the video description to these products where you can pick them up if
you like it I'll put a promo code in there for my
viewers that green stuff world has provided so you can get a discount on
your order let me know what you think do you already have these have are they an
important part of your crafting arsenal if they are let me know do you have them
do you find that it was a wasted purchase because you don't use them very
much curious to know your thoughts like I said this isn't an in-depth review
this is a first impression try out and for first impression I'm pretty happy
with it so let me know what you guys think hit
that like button if you enjoyed this video drop me a comment and all that
other good stuff I will see you again on Friday cheers guys
